data.title: FTC Preparing Possible Antitrust Suit Against Facebook
data.text: Sep.15 -- The FTC is reportedly preparing a possible antitrust suit against Facebook.

data.title: Celebrities Plan an ‘Instagram Freeze,’ but Reaction Is Icy
data.text: Stars including Kim Kardashian West, Katy Perry and Mark Ruffalo said they would protest Facebook by freezing their Instagram accounts on Wednesday. The responses were far from positive.

data.title: Facebook may face FTC antitrust suit as soon as this year
data.text: The agency is looking at whether Facebook is using its dominant position in social media to stifle competition, The Wall Street Journal reports.

data.title: Facebook stock falls after report of potential for FTC antitrust lawsuit this year
data.text: Facebook Inc. FB, +2.35% shares fell 3% in after-hours trading Tuesday after a report that the Federal Trade Commission is preparing to file an antitrust lawsuit against the social-media giant.

data.title: The Wall Street Journal: FTC antitrust suit against Facebook could come by year’s end
data.text: WASHINGTON — The Federal Trade Commission is preparing a possible antitrust lawsuit against Facebook Inc.

data.title: Kim Kardashian Urges Others to Join Instagram, Facebook ‘Freeze’
data.text: Kim Kardashian West says she will be “freezing” her Facebook and Instagram accounts on Wednesday and asked others to do the same “to tell Facebook to #StopHateForProfit.

data.title: Messenger VP details use of forwarding limits and fact-checking to fight misinformation
data.text: A few weeks ago, Facebook Messenger introduced new rules around message forwarding to limit the spread of misinformation on its platform.

data.title: Kim Kardashian West and other celebrities urge Facebook to do more to combat hate speech
data.text: Hollywood stars say they will "freeze" their Facebook and Instagram accounts on Wednesday.

data.title: Sacha Baron Cohen, Kim Kardashian West and other celebrities have declared open season on Facebook
data.text: Sacha Baron Cohen and his celebrity brethren have a bone to pick with Facebook Inc. over misinformation and hate on its sprawling digital platforms.

data.title: Facebook shares fall as Kim Kardashian West calls for one-day boycott
data.text: Celebrities are calling out Facebook for not doing enough to stop disinformation and hate on its platform.

data.title: Kim Kardashian West Freezes Facebook Accounts, Cites Misinformation And Hate Speech
data.text: Kim Kardashian West announced she plans to freeze her social media accounts on Wednesday and is urging her followers to also take part.

data.title: Coronavirus: Facebook and NHS team up for blood donations
data.text: The NHS is partnering with Facebook to enlist new blood donors in England, Wales and Northern Ireland ahead of a potential second wave of COVID-19.

data.title: Facebook Launches New Climate Change Center Amid Wildfires—But Still Won’t Take Down Misinformation
data.text: The company’s statement did not address a “loophole” that has removed fact-checking labels from climate denial posts.

data.title: Facebook gives in to pressure on climate-change myths— including that antifa started deadly wildfires — with new ‘science-based’ hub
data.text: Facebook, long targeted by critics for allowing misinformation on global warming and other environmental developments to populate its social media feed unchecked, announced it will launch a new information hub to provide users with “science-based information” about climate change.

data.title: Facebook’s big redesign broke News Feed extensions—including some fact-checkers
data.text:
A big change in Facebook’s code hurts extensions that customize or fact-check the News Feed. 
In May of this year, Facebook started rolling out a major redesign for its website, with a more modern look, big navigation buttons on top, and a greater emphasis on Groups.

data.title: What Are FANG Stocks, And Should You Invest In Them?
data.text: The acronym FANG refers to four high-growth internet stocks. (Sometimes they're called FAANG stocks.

data.title: Facebook announces $4.3 million grant for small businesses in India, introduces support for gift cards
data.text: More than a third of small and medium-sized businesses on Facebook in India expect cash flow to be a challenge for them as they navigate through the coronavirus pandemic in the next few months, according to a report by Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) and the World Bank. Facebook, which reaches nearly every internet […]

data.title: Facebook Launches Resource Center To Fight Climate Misinformation
data.text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg said Tuesday that the social media platform is launching a dedicated “Climate Science Information Center,” which will contain “authoritative information” from global climate organizations.

data.title: Facebook launches climate information centre
data.text: Facebook has launched a climate science information centre to promote authoritative voices on climate change following wildfires in the US and criticism of the platform for allowing misinformation to spread.

data.title: Facebook and Google announce plans to become carbon neutral
data.text: Firms join Apple and Microsoft in committing to put no excess carbon into the atmosphere

data.title: Facebook to present top climate science through dedicated information hub
data.text: The Climate Science Information Center will connect Facebook users with resources from leading climate organizations.

data.title: Facebook says it will fight climate change myths with new information hub
data.text: Facebook will launch a new section to provide its users with "science-based information" about climate change, the company announced Monday night.

data.title: Facebook Takes Advantage Of Pandemic To Score REI's Sprawling Seattle Area Headquarters
data.text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) has purchased Recreational Equipment Inc.’s newly-completed 400,000 square foot campus in Bellevue, Washington for $390 million, the two companies announced Monday.
